column4: http://www.joeygregorash.ca/ubuntu2.jpg <<---anyone have any ideas on this problem? the same xorg.conf works fine on 6.10
i think I will have to just go back to 6.10
tasos>> run this program and check to make sure that the mic is selected gnome-volume-control
SCGUY918>> check out this picture http://www.joeygregorash.ca/ubuntu2.jpg
patwotrik>> ifconfig
http://www.joeygregorash.ca/ubuntu2.jpg
tasos>> you sure you are not plugged in the "Line In" on the back of your computer?
there has to be a trick to my problem..I am sure I just need like 1 line in my xorg.conf
http://www.joeygregorash.ca/ubuntu2.jpg
tasas>> I don't know...
what *is* the problem?
yes
tell me what I am looking for
ah, you need to change the resolution for the login screen then.  google suggests just removing all of the resolutions you do not use from your xorg.conf...
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FixVideoResolutionHowto#head-9a8fa8e79e2458de1eb69eadb2c97a633be81a42
I didn't suggest a command...
did you try my suggestion?
had what?
that isn't what I suggested.  Did you read the link I gave you?
no... https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FixVideoResolutionHowto#head-9a8fa8e79e2458de1eb69eadb2c97a633be81a42
you reordered the resolutions and it still uses the wrong one?
how do you know it uses the right one?

LCDs have a native resolution.  laptops have two modes.  In one mode they will stretch things when the resolution is too small.  In the other mode, they will do what you are seeing.  It definitely seems like the resolution is the issue.  Why not try the suggestion and see?
did you try to delete all resolutions except the proper one?
